intro: Echites trichotomus, commonly known as the three-parted milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, trifoliate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a tubular shape. It is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many plants in its family. Echites trichotomus thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
